description: 500+ lore entries for pagination testing across multiple categories

entries.content: High-volume entry 001: architectural pattern for message queuing in distributed systems.
High-volume entry 002: observed that retry with exponential backoff reduces thundering herd.
High-volume entry 003: interface segregation keeps client dependencies narrow.
High-volume entry 004: NULL handling in composite unique indexes differs across SQLite versions.
High-volume entry 005: test helper setup takes 3 lines but saves 20 lines per test function.
High-volume entry 006: property-based testing catches edge cases unit tests miss.
High-volume entry 007: go-chi middleware ordering affects which handlers see modified context.
High-volume entry 008: batch INSERT with 100 rows is 10x faster than individual inserts in SQLite.

note: Test code should generate entries by cycling through the 8 template entries with incrementing IDs to reach total_count
